Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 11th overall pick, by Cincinnati in 1979...
Injured on 7/28/1980 with a Strained Hamstring Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 5/14/1983 with a Pulled Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Injured on 8/15/1983 with a Tender Shoulder, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 9/18/1983, off Joel Finch (CHC)...
Injured on 4/29/1984 with a Torn Thigh Muscle, out for 5 weeks...
Hit first career homerun on 5/31/1986, off Steve Farr (STL)...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
Traded from Cincinnati to St. Louis on 7/14/1990 (Going to CIN: 2B M. Lemke, 1B T. Martinez, C P. Clark. Going to STL: 2B S. Sax, P T. Henke, P L. Smith, RF B. Brower, SS J. Valdez)...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/1/1990, hitting .591 with 1 HR, 9 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/12/1993, hitting .478 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Won World Series with St. Louis in 1993...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1994...
Signed as a free agent by Cincinnati on 2/15/1995 to a 2-year deal worth $4,250,000 per year...
